title: Vendor Payments (Purchase Order Summary)
description:
The San Francisco Controller's Office maintains a database of payments made to vendors from fiscal year 2007 forward. This data is presented on the Vendor Payments report hosted at http://openbook.sfgov.org, and is also available in this dataset in CSV format, which represents summary data by purchase order. We have removed sensitive information from this data – this is intended to show payments made to entities providing goods and services to the City and County and to protect individuals. For example, we have removed payments to employees (reimbursements, garnishments) and jury members, revenue refunds, payments for judgments and claims, witnesses, relocation and rehousing, and a variety of human services payments. New data is added on a weekly basis.

Supplier payments represent payments to City contractors and vendors that provide goods and/or services to the City. Certain other non-supplier payee payments, which are made to parties other than traditional City contractors and vendors, are also included in this dataset, These include payments made for tax and fee refunds, rebates, settlements, etc.

columns.name: Fiscal Year
columns.description: An accounting period of 12 months. The City and County of San Francisco operates on a fiscal year that begins on July 1 and ends on June 30 the following year. The Fiscal Year ending June 30, 2012 is represented as FY2011-2012.

columns.name: Related Govt Units
columns.description: In SFOpenBook, these are fiduciary funds and component units that are included in the City’s financial statements but are different in nature from the other funds and organizations in City government. Fiduciary Funds include all Trust and Agency Funds that account for assets held by the City as a trustee or as an agency for individuals or other governmental units.

columns.name: Organization Group Code
columns.description: Org Group is a group of Departments. For example, the Public Protection Org Group includes departments such as the Police, Fire, Adult Probation, District Attorney, and Sheriff.

columns.name: Organization Group
columns.description: Org Group is a group of Departments. For example, the Public Protection Org Group includes departments such as the Police, Fire, Adult Probation, District Attorney, and Sheriff.

columns.name: Department Code
columns.description: Departments are the primary organizational unit used by the City and County of San Francisco. Examples include Recreation and Parks, Public Works, and the Police Department.

columns.name: Department
columns.description: Departments are the primary organizational unit used by the City and County of San Francisco. Examples include Recreation and Parks, Public Works, and the Police Department.

columns.name: Program Code
columns.description: A program identifies the services a department provides. For example, the Police Department has programs for Patrol, Investigations, and Administration.

columns.name: Program
columns.description: A program identifies the services a department provides. For example, the Police Department has programs for Patrol, Investigations, and Administration.

columns.name: Character Code
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Character is the highest level. For example, salaries, benefits, contractual services, and materials & supplies are recorded as different Characters.

columns.name: Character
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Character is the highest level. For example, salaries, benefits, contractual services, and materials & supplies are recorded as different Characters.

columns.name: Object Code
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Object is the middle level. For example, within the Salaries Character, Objects differentiate between Permanent Salaries, Temporary Salaries, and Overtime pay.

columns.name: Object
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Object is the middle level. For example, within the Salaries Character, Objects differentiate between Permanent Salaries, Temporary Salaries, and Overtime pay.

columns.name: Sub-object Code
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Sub-object is the lowest level of detail. For instance, within the Overtime Object, Sub-object segregates overtime for nurses from overtime for police officers and fire fighters (known as uniformed staff).

columns.name: Sub-object
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Sub-object is the lowest level of detail. For instance, within the Overtime Object, Sub-object segregates overtime for nurses from overtime for police officers and fire fighters (known as uniformed staff).

columns.name: Fund Type Code
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Type is the highest level, and is used to group Funds according to governmental accounting standards.

columns.name: Fund Type
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Type is the highest level, and is used to group Funds according to governmental accounting standards.

columns.name: Fund Code
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund is the middle level. For example, within the Special Revenue Fund Type, you can find the Children’s Fund and the Open Space & Park Fund.

columns.name: Fund
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund is the middle level. For example, within the Special Revenue Fund Type, you can find the Children’s Fund and the Open Space & Park Fund.

columns.name: Fund Category Code
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Category is the lowest level. Within Fund, Fund Categories group activity by their characteristics: Operating, Annual Projects, Continuing Projects, Grants, Interdepartmental/Work Order.

columns.name: Fund Category
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Category is the lowest level. Within Fund, Fund Categories group activity by their characteristics: Operating, Annual Projects, Continuing Projects, Grants, Interdepartmental/Work Order.

columns.name: Purchase Order
columns.description: A Purchase Order is a document that reserves a specific amount of money for payment to a vendor for a specific purpose.

columns.name: Supplier & Other Non-Supplier Payees
columns.description: An organization that the City pays in return for goods or services.

columns.name: Vouchers Paid
columns.description: Completed payments to vendors.

columns.name: Vouchers Pending
columns.description: Payments to vendors that have been requested but not yet paid.

columns.name: Encumbrance Balance
columns.description: The unused portion of an encumbrance document.

columns.name: Vouchers Pending Retainage
columns.description: Payments to vendors that have been requested but not yet paid due to agreed-upon contract retainage.

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp the data was updated in the source system.

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp the data was loaded to the open data portal.

columns.name: Non-Profit Indicator
columns.description: Indicates whether the supplier is a non-profit organization, based on self-reported business entity type

columns.name: Contract Number
columns.description: The unique identifier of the contract associated with the purchase order

columns.name: Contract Title
columns.description: A brief description of the contract associated with the purchase order

columns.name: Purchase Order Date
columns.description: The date of the purchase order

columns.name: Purchasing Authority Description
columns.description: The legal authority permitting the purchase

whom_it_may_interest: This data may interest economists, city planners, independent auditors, and anyone else interested in how much San Francisco spends and on what. It contains detailed financial data that could potentially uncover interesting trends.

queries.Monthly: SELECT date_trunc_ym(purchase_order_date) as month, sum(vouchers_paid) as sum_vouchers_paid, department, program, character, object, sub_object WHERE purchase_order_date >= start_date GROUP BY month, department, program, character, object, sub_object
queries.Yearly: SELECT date_trunc_ym(purchase_order_date) as month, sum(vouchers_paid) as sum_vouchers_paid, department, program, character, object, sub_object WHERE purchase_order_date >= start_date GROUP BY year, department, program, character, object, sub_object
